they saw how markets when left to

just the private property of big

the prizes you can offer the services
the innovation that you produce that's

but let's take a step back why why do we

since more competition drives more

well mostly it is but the problem is
that sometimes for businesses
competition can be inconvenient because
competition means that the race is never

well you were doing in the past there's

to take your place so the temptation to

rooted in motives as old as Adam and Eve
in greed for yet more money in fear of

all the benefits it brings and when

mix of of greed and fear means that
those who get power becomes reluctant to
give it back one of the many things I I
like and admire in our democracies other

competition rules can do a similar thing

because those rules mean that companies

the European Commission has dealt with

we're in the market and we don't want
